title: Nibunkatsu One
subtitle: にぶんかつ ✦ Nibunkatsu is the Japanese word for Splitting in Half
description: にぶんかつ ✦ A fully custom split keyboard!

content.heading: About Nibunkatsu
content.text:
Nibunkatsu is a split keyboard mainly designed for typing and programming. It was fully designed, engineered & planned out in only 7 days. Ordering and assemlby took part during the following weeks.

 The first iteration was funded by Blueprint, a movement by Hack Club and AMD (yes AMD) to empower teenagers to build tech projects and actually bring them to life!

content.heading: The Split Mechanism
content.text:
Although Nibunkatsu is not an innovation in any realms, it's a very cool concept which I've been aching to try for a while!

Both halves run on the ESP32-S3 MCU, and communicate together ~~using a 3.5mm TRRS cable~~ by ESP-NOW. The original plan for communicating through the TRRS cable was scrapped due to having chosen an incorrect female connector, supporting only a TRS connection.

content.heading: CAD Design
content.text: This project obliged me to try CAD designing for the first time ever. It looked intimidating at first, but once I got into it, it turned out to be quite straightforward. The case I made for Nibunkatsu is my first ever 3D design fully made by me. I'm proud of the results and feel this represents a significant milestone in my design journey.

content.heading: Other functionality
content.text: Each half has a distinct feature, the left side has a small 0.91' display with custom UI designed using LOPAKA.app, and the right side features a rotary knob. Both halves work together with layers which are toggleable using special keys on the thumbs.

content.heading: Open Source
content.text: Nibunkatsu One is completely open-source, available on my GitHub (link available on top). This includes:
list: Complete PCB schematics and layouts (made in EasyEDA)
3D model files for the case (.3MF format)
The updated Circuit Python code that runs on my own personal build! Based on the KMK keyboard firmware framework
